title: "What are the techniques for inducing ecstasy in non-verbal hypnosis therapy?"
first_phrase: This last part of the text focuses on different techniques and exercises that can induce a state of ecstasy for therapeutic benefits. The first exercise involves healing spinal pain through magnetic passes and butterfly movements. The text also explains how to induce ecstasy through a hypnotic state, working on the energy going up and activating both hemispheres of the brain. The text then moves on to explain the Magnetic Circle that aims to introduce people to non-verbal hypnosis and induce deep trances for therapeutic purposes. The text concludes with the teaching of two crucial techniques - the closure of senses and the ten plexuses techniques aimed at inducing a magnetic state of the patient quickly.
content: ============================================= Hermetic view: we could say that worked on the spine we worked on "warming the mercury" It is very interesting to analyse what happens when we do ecstasy For the ancient mercury was identified with the nervous system . We have two positions for our nervous system - NORMAL - excitated this excitation is an excitation of our nervous system Exitation can happen also in front of the unknown ============================================= For doing the preceding exercise to do magnetism we had to induce our partner There is a faster way of doing it than with magnetic passes. We call this technique "closure of the senses" The closure of the senses is the companion of another technique called of the 10 plexuses BENEFITS of the closure of the senses: realizing a magnetic state in a faster way BENEFITS of the 10 plexuses technique: it can be good for anxiety, it can also be done after a crisis LEARNING THE TWO TECHNIQUES We proceed now with to learn two further important techniques: Closure of the senses Technique of the 10 plexuses CLOSING THE SENSES AND INITIAL EQUALIZATION -. What are the twelve main passes to equalize the magnetic force in the patient? The following: 1 ° Three passes with the thumb, from the top and the middle of the forehead, over the nose and towards the pit of the stomach; 2 ° Three with the index finger, starting from the middle of the eyebrows; 3 ° Three with the medium, starting from the center of the ears. 4. Three with the last two fingers, starting from the jaw.
last_phrase: In conclusion, non-verbal communication plays a crucial role in hypnosis and can be used effectively to induce magnetic states and create reactions in individuals. The closure of the senses and 10 plexuses technique can help achieve a magnetic state much faster. The principle of proxemics, touch, and sounds can be used to stimulate unconscious responses. The hypnodrama and swaying test are effective in identifying and addressing a person's problems. Remember to focus on true archetypes rather than psychological interpretations and always maintain a positive presence as a therapist to elicit positive reactions from clients.
